dimensions: plate (sheet trimmed to plate): 7.5 cm (2 15/16 in.)
creditline: Bequest of Junius S. Morgan, Class of 1888
markings: In graphite, verso left: Leipzig 1929, 280 Rks
inscribed:
In margin around medallion, containing a chronogram [1584], the name and age [23] of the sitter: VICenIs tres adIICIens nataLIbVs annos, PLeIobIVs pVLCre sIC ora ferebat ErasMVs

Signed in outer margin, lower right: H.Goltzius f.
catalograisonne: Bartsch 213; Dutuit 515; Hollstein 208; New Hollstein 242; Weigel 341

makers.displaydate: 1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands
makers.displaymaker: Hendrick Goltzius, 1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands

texts.textentryhtml: Possibly Jan Six [1618-1700]. Possibly Rijksmuseum, Rijksprentenkabinet, Amsterdam; deaccessioned. Presumably sale in Leipzig, 1929; Junius S. Morgan [1867-1932]; bequeathed to Princeton University Art Museum, 1932.

, no. 208, p. 64
